Understand that my liberation is tied up with yours and that nobody wins unless we all win. Understand that hope is not na√Øve. I'm so excited and looking forward to representing this district for another term.

I‚Äôm prepping for my PROPOSITION agenda when we take control:

Medicare for ALL‚Ää

Dignity for detained Immigrants Act

College for All

Gun Reform

Democracy Reform

Expanding social security by scrapping the cap

Investing $2 trillion in green infrastructure

Net neutrality

We have to win back the majority in the House, and if we do our part in the 8th, 5th, and 3rd Districts in Washington we can win that majority. I‚Äôm supporting real progressives, women, folks of color across the country.

Our work is broad and deep. It goes to making sure I prioritize diversity in my offices and I‚Äôm so proud that I have one of the most diverse offices in Congress. We don‚Äôt have to steer away from race, we do better when we name it, introduce it and talk about it.

As I said when I first ran, this has never been about ME, it has always been about WE. And that‚Äôs why I am so fierce when people try to put me down‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääbecause, you see, when they do that, they are putting everyone in our district down.

I believed that after 15 years of being an activist, that it was time to take over the platform of elected. Why should we just advocate to elected officials? We should BE elected officials ourselves, bring OUR voices into the system, changing it from within and without.
I ran for office because I believe something else is possible. Our opening is connection. Connecting women to race, race to climate, climate to jobs, jobs to choices around our own bodies.

We must lift up the center of America‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääthe people whose work sustains us, grows our economy, and takes care of those who cannot work. The teacher who spends more time with our children than any other but hasn‚Äôt been compensated for that.

Failure has taught us that we must reject the false choices, that as proud as I am to be a progressive, that the ideas we stand for as progressives are really ideas for working people, ideas that are ‚Äúcentrist‚Äù in that they serve the center of our society‚Ää.
Failure is sometimes necessary to awaken us. Failure, if we use it correctly, can be our alarm clock. To dig ourselves from out of this hole, we must engage differently.

We failed because we didn‚Äôt insist often enough and loudly enough, and organize deeply enough to show that the false choices we are presented with every day are wrong, immoral and not really a choice at all.
We allowed corporations and the wealthiest to convince us that our voices don‚Äôt matter and the system is too corrupt to make a difference‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääand so we stop engaging, voting, even caring.

Still, we are where we are today because we failed. We failed because we gave away our power. And there are lessons to learn from failure and things that happen out of failure that help us to move forward, but first we have to name that we failed.
